title.narrative: F.a: Capacitating human rights activists on security issues

description.narrative: DPI intends to promote security, safety and protection management good practices through expert knowledge and experience sharing platforms that shall be branded as Eekyoto. The Eekyoto activity shall bring together maximum forty (40) persons including but not limited to HRDs, Security focal persons of different HRD organisations, members of the National Security Committees (LGBT), Security Working Group (LGBT), some members of the state authorities (police) in line of security management to share practical solutions in dealing with emerging security threats. It will also offer an opportunity to network and promote inter organisational security management practice. The project activities are designed as a practicum for HRDs security and protection management. They focus on the how to? assess risks, design, implement and evaluate organisation security policy, as well as the development of a systematic security approach to HRDs work. The proposed follow-up and coaching activities and quarterly HRDs security mana gement discussions (Eekyoto) will empower the defenders to undertake their own security risk assessments and define security policies and procedures or other protocols for individual and organisational protection to suit their particular situations. It is expected that by the end of the project, the participants will be able to mainstream security and protection management into individual and organisational work, e.g. develop and implement realistic security plans, evaluate and update it whenever need arise s to suit the context. Participants will also learn to establish positive relationships with potential allies including state actors without compromising their respective goals and missions and apply the newly acquired skills to enhance their security and protection hence contributing to a safer working environment for HRDS in Uganda. DPI's fervent expectation is to have government support the law that protects the rights of HRDs in Uganda.
